title: Modest Mouse Announce New Music Festival: Flaming Lips, Built to Spill, Sleater-Kinney, and More
description: The Psychic Salamander Festival will take place September 13 and 14 in Carnation, Washington
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The Psychic Salamander Festival will take place September 13 and 14 in Carnation, Washington
text: Modest Mouse have announced the inaugural Psychic Salamander Festival, a two-day music festival at Remlinger Farms in Carnation, Washington. It’s set to take place on Saturday, September 13 and Sunday, September 14, and will feature double headlining sets from Isaac Brock and his band, alongside performances from Built to Spill, Sleater-Kinney, and Flaming Lips, who will perform their 1999 album The Soft Bulletin in full at their Sunday show. Scroll down to check out the full lineup and festival poster.Earlier this month, Modest Mouse announced Ice Cream Floats, a five-day music festival that will take place in 2026 on the Norwegian Pearl cruise ship. In March, the band kicked off their international co-headlining tour with the Flaming Lips, which will continue through September with stops in Europe, the U.K., Canada, and the United States. Last year, they reissued their 2004 album Good News for People Who Love Bad News to celebrate its 20th anniversary.Revisit our review of Modest Mouse’s 2021 album The Golden Casket, and read “The 150 Best Albums of the 1990s,” featuring The Lonesome Crowded West at No. 125.
html:
Modest Mouse have announced the inaugural Psychic Salamander Festival, a two-day music festival at Remlinger Farms in Carnation, Washington. It’s set to take place on Saturday, September 13 and Sunday, September 14, and will feature double headlining sets from Isaac Brock and his band, alongside performances from Built to Spill, Sleater-Kinney, and Flaming Lips, who will perform their 1999 album The Soft Bulletin in full at their Sunday show. Scroll down to check out the full lineup and festival poster.

Earlier this month, Modest Mouse announced Ice Cream Floats, a five-day music festival that will take place in 2026 on the Norwegian Pearl cruise ship. In March, the band kicked off their international co-headlining tour with the Flaming Lips, which will continue through September with stops in Europe, the U.K., Canada, and the United States. Last year, they reissued their 2004 album Good News for People Who Love Bad News to celebrate its 20th anniversary.

Revisit our review of Modest Mouse’s 2021 album The Golden Casket, and read “The 150 Best Albums of the 1990s,” featuring The Lonesome Crowded West at No. 125.
